first: ^!!! You have a package here!! Go downstairs.
second: ^But the only problem is I don't know how to assemble them.
^Oh, Ian can help me with this...
third: ^Hi Ian! There are some mysterious packages that came to our house.
^Well, I don't know, but can you help me build a computer from these parts?
^Of course! Where can we build it?
^I have a desk in my room at my house. We can use it as our building desk.
fourth: ^I invited Ian to help me build these parts, Mom.
^Ok, sure. Have you both had dinner yet?
^Come with me, we should go upstairs to build this PC.
fifth: ^I want you to open your building desk.
sixth: ^Now, I want you to put your <color=orange>case</color> on the table first.
^(Click the <color=orange>Case Button</color> and select the case.)
^(Click the <color=green>Use Button</color> to place the case.)
sixthDoneCase: ^(Click the <color=green>Motherboard Button</color> and select the motherboard.)
^(Click the <color=green>Use Button</color> to place the motherboard.)
sixthDoneMB: ^(Click the <color=yellow>CPU Button</color> and select the CPU.)
^(Click the <color=green>Use Button</color> to place the CPU.)
sixthDoneCPU: ^Next, we need to cool the CPU to process data smoothly.
^So we need the <color=green>CPU fan</color> for it.
^(Click the <color=green>CPU Fan Button</color> and select the CPU fan you want.)
^(Click the <color=green>Use Button</color> to place the CPU fan.)
sixthDoneCPUFan: ^Next, we need to place the <color=lightblue>RAM</color> in this beast.
^(Click the <color=lightblue>RAM Button</color> and select the RAM you have.)
^(Click the <color=green>Use Button</color> to place the RAM.)
sixthDoneRAM: ^Next is the Graphics Processing Unit of your computer, or in short, the <color=yellow>GPU</color>.
^(Click the <color=yellow>GPU Button</color> and select the GPU you want.)
^(Click the <color=green>Use Button</color> to place the GPU.)
sixthDoneGPU: ^It can be SSD or HDD, but for now, use the one you have.
^(Click the <color=green>Storage Button</color> and select the storage you want.)
^(Click the <color=green>Use Button</color> to place the storage.)
sixthDoneStorage: ^This is the Power Supply Unit of your computer, or in short, the <color=lightblue>PSU</color>, to power up your computer.
^(Click the <color=lightblue>PSU Button</color> and select the PSU you want.)
^(Click the <color=green>Use Button</color> to place the PSU.)
sixthDonePSU: ^, now install the Operating System on your computer.
^(Click the <color=lightblue>Done Button</color> to turn on and install the OS, then click the Install Button and wait for it.)
sixthDoneClick: ^, now your PC boots up. We just need to install the OS.
^(Click the <color=aqua>Install Button</color> to install the OS and wait for it.)
sixthDoneInstall: ^(You can rename your PC and click Done.)
sixthRenamed: ^Wow! Your PC is ready to go. Do you have another desk or room to set up your setup? I have a spare monitor, mouse, and keyboard here.
^Yes, I have a storage room, but it's empty. There's just a desk in there.
^It’s a perfect place to set up this PC.
^Ok, let's go back to your room.
Seventh: ^Now, go to the room. All we need to do is set up your PC.
Eight: ^It's all set. All you need to do is place your PC on the desk.
^(Open the <color=green>Computers Button</color>, click the computer, and click the <color=green>Use Button</color>.)
EightSecond: ^Nice! It's all set. All we need to do is turn on this computer.
Nine: ^Come downstairs. I have something for you both.
^We need to go downstairs first, Ian.
NiceThird: ^My mom needs me at the house.
^. You just need to go there and turn it on.
^Just meet me at my house if you have any questions.
Ten: ^That was delicious, Mom. Thank you very much.
^But I need to go upstairs. The computer is ready to go.
^You should go, my dear, and enjoy your new computer.
Eleven: ^Wow, this is my first time having a computer!
^I was just dreaming of a computer earlier, and now I have one.
^I wonder where the parts came from, but never mind, at least I have one.
^Now, all I need to do is turn on this computer.
ElevenSecond: ^Wow, the computer is booting up. This is exciting!
ElevenThird: ^Great! So this is the desktop. I should explore what these icons are first.
TwelveMYPC: ^Wow, so this is the information about my computer.
^It lists all the parts that my computer has.
TwelveShop: ^So, this is the website where I can buy new monitors, keyboards, mice, desks, and decorations for my setup.
TwelveSettings: ^Ok, just the settings of the game.
TwelveStats: ^I wonder what the stats are all about, but it's probably something about me.
TwelveHardwares: ^I wonder what's inside this game. I should click the play button.
TwelvePlayToMap: ^And the land is named after computer parts.
^The CPU region is already unlocked. I should check it out.
Thirteen: ^There's a person here. I should talk to him...
ThirteenTwo: ^Yes? Why? And also, I received some mysterious computer parts earlier.
^I didn’t even order this stuff online.
^Yes, of course! I really want a computer, so I assembled it.
^After I built it, I opened a mysterious game called "The Hardwares" and got sucked into the monitor.
^I'm also stuck here and I want to go home. I was teleported here after building that mysterious part as well...
^I was also wishing for a good computer that I could use, and some mysterious packages came to my home too...
^I built it, tried it, opened that icon, and got sucked into the monitor...
^I don’t know what to do here...
^How can I help you if I don’t even know what to do here myself?
^I explored the village, and they said there is an old man here who knows about this village. They called him...
^Find that mysterious man and talk to me again if you find him. I know he has answers to our questions.
^I'm afraid. I don't have the courage to find him, sorry.
Fourteen: ^That question is just like "why are you here?"
^, our lives have many mysterious ways to achieve something.
^And this is one of those ways for you to achieve that "something."
^You’re dreaming about a wonderful computer, right?
^Yes? I want a computer because it can help me with my studies.
^You are here because we want you to achieve that.
^You see, this is a CPU world. The CPU is the brain of the computer. Without the CPU, you can't run a computer.
^So you’re the one who sent those parts to my house?
^Yes, but I’m not the only one.
^Did you see the map of the game you’re in?
^It has all the regions for the necessary parts of a computer.
^Those regions have an abundance of materials needed to make those computer parts.
^For example, this is the CPU region because we have plenty of silicon here.
^Silicon is the main ingredient to create a CPU.
^But there’s another reason we sent you here,
^Back then, we didn’t send people here.
^The Exchangers of different regions only wanted to fulfill the dreams of people like you.
^We just gave them their dream parts to make them happy and help them achieve their goals.
^We were like Santa Claus, but in the world of computers, for those who wished to have one.
^But our region has been troubled by some bad creatures or people, or a bunch of enemies who only want our materials.
^They steal the materials we use to create computer parts, and those materials vanish as they steal more and more.
^No! I don’t want to, and I can’t, sorry.
^I just want to go back home.
^What if I told you that if you fight those bad creatures and recover the stolen materials, you can exchange them with me for computer parts?
^Also, this is the only way to get you back home.
^And you’ll have the privilege to return here anytime you want to exchange materials for parts as you fight those bad creatures.
^Just help us retain what was ours,
^The bad creatures are spawning in the wide area of our village where the materials are abundant.
^Find that area and kill those bad creatures.
^Come back to me if you collect any materials.
^After that, I will open the gate where you’ll be teleported back home.
^And the parts you exchange will be delivered to your home immediately as you exchange them with me.
^Now go, find that area, and fight those bad creatures who are stealing our natural resources.
Fifteen: ^I should go back first to the Lost Adventurer to tell him what I’ve learned about this madness.
FifteenTwo: ^You told me that you’re also dreaming about a computer, right?
^They sent you those computer parts to bring you here...
^You’re supposed to fight the creatures that are troubling this village’s resources.
^The Exchanger couldn’t find you, so they sent someone else, and that’s me.
^So how can we get out of here,
^I have to fight those bad creatures and collect their stolen materials.
^I have some gold here, and I’ll give it to you.
^I heard there’s a sword dealer in this village.
^Go find him and get ready to fight those creatures.
^Ok, I will get us out of here.
SixteenIntro: ^I should find this sword dealer in the village.
Sixteen: ^Yes! I have plenty of the finest swords in this village.
SixteenTwo: ^By the way, can I ask why you're buying a sword?
^The Exchanger told me that there are some creatures bothering your village.
^Ahh, yes, these creatures are bad and merciless. They just want our silicon.
^And these creatures don’t just exist in our region; they’re also in the RAM region, CPU fan region, and all the others.
^I don’t know why they do this... maybe they want a computer too! Hahaha.
^Well, good luck with those creatures, Adventurer.
SeventeenIntro: ^I should find that area and start fighting the bad creatures.
Seventeen: ^So, this is the area they were talking about...
^I should start fighting those creatures to get us home.
EighteenIntro: ^Whew, that was intense, but they were weak. I thought they'd be stronger...
^I also got their money and materials...
^I should head back to the Exchanger now.
Eighteen: ^And I have the materials you wanted.
^. You are the savior of our region.
^You can exchange your materials with me to upgrade your computer parts.
^I’ll also unlock the teleporter so you can return home.
^Don’t forget, you can come back here anytime.
^I also hope you’ll help the other regions to retain their materials in exchange for computer parts.
^Here are the materials I have. They will renew every 2 minutes.
Nineteen: ^Your CPU will be delivered immediately to your home.
^Now, come with me to the spawn, and I’ll get you home.
NineteenTwo: ^I was waiting for you to come to me, but you didn’t.
^Never mind, I’ll get you both home.
TwentyOne: ^That's the CPU I exchanged from the CPU Exchanger yesterday!
TwentyTwo: ^Sheesh... This is the CPU I exchanged from the CPU Exchanger.
^I should go to my desk and modify my computer.
TwentyThree: ^I should place my computer here first.
^Open The Hardwares by clicking the <color=lightblue>Hardwares button</color>.
TwentyFourDoneComputers: ^Now select the computer you want to modify, then click the <color=orange>Modify button</color>.
TwentyFourDoneModify: ^Nice! Now I should replace my old CPU with the one I got from the exchanger.
^After that, click the <color=green>Done Button</color> to successfully modify your computer.
TwentyFive: ^Your computer parts have perks that make you stronger in the Hardwares World.
^You can see them in the information about your computer.
^You can also check the perks you used while building your computer by clicking the <color=yellow>Perks Button</color> in the upper right corner.
^That’s nice. I should probably go back to the Hardwares World and continue my adventures...
^But before that, I should meet the CPU Exchanger again to get more info about the other regions.
TwentySixIntro: ^I should meet the CPU Exchanger again in the CPU region to get more info about the other regions.
TwentySix: ^I want to know more about the other regions.
^Ahh, ok. To unlock those regions, you need to become stronger too.
^As you fight the bad creatures and collect their materials, you can also exchange those materials with the exchangers of each region.
^They’ll give you the computer parts you want.
^So, I need to become stronger to unlock those regions? Why?
^I fought the bad creatures here, but they were weak. Do I really need to get stronger?
^Yes, as you progress through the regions, the enemies get stronger and faster too.
^The strongest enemies are in the Case region. They are elites, and you need to fight them for us to be fully functional again.
^You’ll need to buy powerful swords, armor, a shield, and a helmet, especially the computer parts we exchange for you.
^Those computer parts aren’t just ordinary parts; they’ll make you stronger because of the perks they have.
^. Don’t hesitate to come to me if you want to exchange some materials for a CPU. Sometimes, I’ll even have legendary CPUs available.
TwentySevenRam: ^Now, I will work to unlock the RAM Region.
TwentySevenCase: ^Now the last region, the Case Region.
TwentySevenUnlocked: ^Nice! I unlocked all the regions. I should go to the Case Region and meet the Exchanger.
TwentyEight: ^Nice! I unlocked all the Hardware Regions.
^I should meet the Case Exchanger now.
TwentyEightTwo: ^I’ve been waiting for you to come for a long time,
^Yes, the journey was tough, but I handled it easily.
^The enemies are much stronger than those in the other regions.
^They steal our resources and infest our village.
^Are you strong enough to fight them,
^Well, of course! I’m strong enough, and I want to fight them.
^I also want to upgrade my Case, so don’t worry, I’ll handle them.
^Come back to me and exchange the materials you’ve collected, ok?
TwentyNineIntro: ^I should go to the Case Enemy Area and fight the Horde.
ThirtyIntro: ^I should go back to the Case Exchanger and exchange the material that I collected for the case.
Thirty: ^Ok, that was unexpected, but at least I finished it...
^I should go back to the Case Exchanger and exchange the material that I collected for the case.
ThirtyTwo: ^Yes, I also got their money and materials.
^Here, exchange those materials for a case.
ThirtyThree: ^The case will be delivered to your house.
^You can collect it and upgrade your computer’s aesthetics.
^Each region has second villages with even stronger enemies than before.
^You can continue your journey and defeat those enemies.
^But for now, thank you very much again,
^You are our guardian angel here in the Hardwares World.
^The CPU Exchanger did not make a mistake in choosing you as the protector of our world.
^I should head back home and collect the case.
ThirtyFour: ^I should collect the case downstairs and modify my PC.
ThirtyFive: ^Now, all I need to do is place this case on my current PC.
^I should go to my building desk.
ThirtySixIntroTwo: ^Nice, I successfully modified my PC. Now I should go to my desktop to check it out.
ThirtySix: ^After all of that journey and adventure, I finally built my dream PC through my own hard work.
^I finally made it, thanks to the Exchanger and even the enemies, although they weren’t kind to me.
^I still owe them because I successfully built my PC, not just through donations from the Exchangers, hehe.
^Now, I can repeat the process to gain more parts and build more computers.
^The Case Exchanger also said that the journey isn’t over yet—there are more villages plagued by enemies.
^But for now, I’ll just enjoy the success and appreciate my beloved PC.
